The current value of 0.5 for the prefs print.print_margin_bottom, print.print_margin_left, print.print_margin_right, and print.print_margin_top prevent users from being able to control printing using CSS margin settings.

End users should not be forced to open about:config to control print margins. 

Reproducible: Always

richard@mozilla.com
comments.text: What's the rationale for preventing users from printing within 3/4 of an inch of the page now?  These margins serve no useful purpose.  The print drivers supply values for unprintable margins on a printer-by-printer basis.   The current print.print_margin_xxx values simply take control away from the user and the web page and web app developers.
